answers.answer: Immigration services are organized regionally across Romania, with offices listed for Bucharest and Ilfov, and then categorized into Northern, Eastern, Southern, and Western parts of the country, each containing various County Immigration Offices/Services and Regional Centres for Asylum Seekers.
